questions.question_text:
You need to update the Service Fee field to meet requirements.
What should you modify?

choices.A: Delete the field from the solution in the Sandbox environment.
choices.B: Remove the field from the solution in the Sandbox environment.
choices.C: Remove the field from the solution in the QA environment.
choices.D: Delete the field from the solution in the QA environment.

discussion.content:
Answer is:
D - because the case study says: modification to the Patient form needs to be tested immediately, but the Invoice form modification needs to be tested the following week. Exist in sandbox only one solution that include both Patient and Invoice therefore you can only remove directly the field on QA

I think the correct answer should be A, since if you deploy a next time, the field will be recreated and therefore undoing your change. If using managed solutions, this will also delete the field form QA environment.

I would pick C - remove the field from the solution in QA
Why?
1. I would remove and not delete because the field is only redundant in the patient form, the field might still be useful in another form. So I guess remove field from the form in the solution is what is implied.
2. I picked QA because, testing occurs in QA and solutions in QA will be the one to be imported into the production instance where it will be used by all, so why should I make the changes in Sandbox?

Status is a system field when you create a custom entity. So you wouldn't be able to delete. So it's either removing field from QA or Sandbox depending on which you think is correct.

Moreover, "There is one solution in the Sandbox environment containing modifications to the Patient and Invoice forms" so removing the field from here would be sufficient. I think it's implied that you would be removing the field from the form however poorly worded question I guess (This justification only works with B though)

comments.content:
I think what a couple people are missing is that the redundant field referenced is *not* the status field.
Requirements state that information stored in the status field must be retained. Then in the issues section it says the status field no longer needs to be shown on the form. However, the mention that the nurse found a "redundant field" is completely separate. That redundant field is in fact another unrelated field. Not the status system field.
I meant to say the answer is A. I'm not sure I see how the urgency of moving to QA overrides the need to have a copy in your Sandbox.

discussion.content:
The best answer is D because:
1. The data is redundant and therefore does NOT need to be retained.
2. "All changes are first created in the Sandbox environment and then imported into the QA environment for testing."

B is 100% the correct answer.

"All changes are first created in the Sandbox environment and then imported into the QA environment for testing." = SANDBOX

remove the field rather than delete to keep the data

Deleting field deletes the data:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/delete-fields

Requirement is for the data to be retained.

Removing field I assume applies to the removing field from the form only.

Hence, I think the "remove" word is more applicable here.

Now in regards to "sandbox" or "QA". There is no mentioning of the managed solution, and requirement is to be tested ASAP. So I would make the changes in the QA right away so they can test.

It states that the change about the patient has to be tested immediately, so the answer should be to delete it directly in QA. Obviously, if then is not deleted also from sandbox the field we'll be created again, but it seems that "resolve" in this case means to have a successful test.

"Testers only have access to the QA environment where testing occurs.
Doctors and nurses enter patient, billing, diagnostic, and other information directly."
Nurse, doesn't has access to the Sandbox. So, it is should be
I think B is a correct answer

comments.content: Removing the field from the solution doesnt remove the field from the form. I think you should delete the field. Before deleting the field you should remove it from the form of course. this looks like the best solution.
it states that "The modification to the Patient form needs to be tested immediately". Thus you should make the change on QA environment

discussion.content: All changes are first created in the Sandbox environment and then imported into the QA environment for testing, So the best option would be: B - Remove the field from the solution in the Sandbox environment.

questions.question_text:
You need to resolve the redundant field issue.
What should you do?

choices.C: Add attendance log to the related record types.
choices.A: Transfer the Child Attendance report by using a third-party tool.
choices.B: Open the Child Attendance report from the sandbox and change the data source to production.
choices.D: Add the report to a solution and export the solution. Next, import the exported solution into production.

questions.question_text:
You need to make the Child Attendance report available.
What should you do?

discussion.content: A is the corret answer. Infact the report is a Word template and a word template can't be exported using a solution

comments.content: Thanks for the link documenting this.

discussion.content:
'A' is correct answer, XRM Toolbox has a plugin "Document Templates Mover" to promote document templates.
https://community.dynamics.com/crm/b/debajitcrm/posts/how-do-i-move-my-word-template-for-custom-entity-across-environments-in-dynamics-365-how-can-i-make-the-changes-manually-a-deep-dive-into-inner-workings

You create a Child Attendance report and complete testing of the report in a sandbox environment. The report is ready for deployment to the production environment.

Answer should be D.

You can add, import, or export snapshots of reports as part of a solution. In model-driven apps, reports, sub reports, report category, report display area, and report-related record type are considered as components of a report set.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/maker/model-driven-apps/add-reporting-to-app

D is the correct answer guys
Microsoft states that "Word templates allow creating standardised documents for an Entity and populate data in a structured format"
The reports are created using templates and he templates belong to an Entity , which in turn are included in a solution.

See link below
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/using-word-templates-dynamics-365
Answer is A, they shouldnt call it a report since it is a Word Template.

A is the correct answer.

"Reports are created from Microsoft Word templates for the healthcare workers"
This means that the report isn't a physical report, it is a word template that shows the attendance. Document templates cannot be added to solution to be imported to the destination environment, migration of Document templates requires third-party application (like xrmToolBox plugin ...).
XRM ToolBox is a great tool which might include a plugin to facilitate the process. However, for the purpose of the test, answer A applies.
Word templates cannot be included as part of the solution promotion process (Deployment). This is a CRM CE limitation. The correct answer is A.
Word templates can't be exported via solutions so I'll go with A
Correct!

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics for Sales administrator for a car dealership. The dealership uses only out-of-the-box functionality. When a new car is sold, the salesperson uses a Word template to generate a letter from the quote to thank the customer.
You need to determine if you can revise the template.
Which Word template change can you make?

choices.A: Format the table to have alternating color rows.
choices.B: Format the Created On field to a long date format.
choices.D: Add the address of the customer.

discussion.content: Correct

correct

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service system administrator.
You must create a new entity to support a new feature. Entity data will be transactional and will be associated with business units.
You need to configure entity ownership.
Which entity ownership type should you use?
